intro: Rubus radula var. genevieri, commonly known as the genevieri raspberry, is a variant of the raspberry plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a shrub with thorny stems and compound leaves, typically featuring three to five leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are usually red when mature, though they may vary in color depending on the variety. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or open areas with well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated for its edible berries.
